Description: Body fragment (from lower part) of North Ionian pottery oinochoe; interior reserved; exterior: cream slip, dark brown and red paint: part of a wild goat to right with thick band of black and red stripes below; filling ornaments: clumsily drawn rosettes and elaborate roundel; in zone below, rays.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Published in CVA Oxford 2, II D, p. 78, no. 11, pl. IV.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (II D p. 78 and pl. IV, 11)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1203)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
